alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 19 at 5:56AM ChST until January 22 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West, north, and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 AM Friday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Friday to 6 AM Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through 6 AM Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
